[h1]Predefined Variables[/h1]

A [b]superglobal[/b] is a predefined variable that is always accessible, regardless of scope. You can access the PHP superglobals through any function, class, or file.

PHP's superglobal variables are $_SERVER, $GLOBALS, $_REQUEST, $_POST, $_GET, $_FILES, $_ENV, $_COOKIE, $_SESSION.

[h2]$_SERVER[/h2]

[b]$_SERVER[/b] is an array that includes information such as headers, paths, and script locations. The entries in this array are created by the web server.
[b]$_SERVER['SCRIPT_NAME'][/b] returns the path of the current script: [code format="php" codeId="493"]<?php
echo $_SERVER['SCRIPT_NAME'];
//Outputs "/somefile.php"
?>[/code]
[note]Our example was written in a file called [b]somefile.php[/b], which is located in the root of the web server.[/note]
